title: Yorktown Battlefield Part of Colonial National Historical Park: Getting Around
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Getting Around              Getting Around           Yorktown Battlefield Tour Roads Tour Roads are open to pedestrians, bicycles and motor vehicles. Safety issues prohibit buses, motor homes or vehicles over 5-tons from using them. All state and local traffic regulations apply. The Battlefield Driving Tour Roads are 16 miles in their entirety and are best experienced with a motor vehicle or by bicycle. There is a fee to drive the Battlefield Tour Roads and a map of the Battlefield Tour Roads is available in the Visitor Center.                 The Yorktown Trolley is transportation service provided by York County, throughout the village of Yorktown from the Yorktown Battlefield to the Yorktown Victory Center, as well as several stops in between, including Riverwalk Landing on a seasonal basis. (NOTE: The trolley does not travel the Yorktown Battlefield tour roads).These buses are handicap accessible.   The Yorktown Trolley is not available during Winter Months.         BICYCLING INFORMATION          DIRECTIONS
